data.title: My Friendship With Arthur C. Clarke
data.meta_description: Blue Planet Red, an award-winning Mars documentary on the history, evidence for life, and catastrophes that contributed to the death of the red planet.
data.text:
"Awesome and powerful, like a force of nature"

"Magnificent"

"Masterful and beautiful"

"I thought I loved science before"

"I need to watch it over and over again"

"A highly absorbing and intricate story line on many different levels"

"Really impressive and fascinating"

"A work of art on so many levels"

"The cinematography and production quality are great"

"The soundtrack is very good"

"Absolutely recommended"

"Visually intriguing and has a great soundtrack"

"Amazing and beautifully done"

"Iâ€™m really searching for criticism"

"A fun romp"

"Many credible experts"

"Superb"

"Culminates in explosive and destructive symbolism"

"Gave me the chills"

"I was entirely absorbed"

"I thoroughly enjoyed every minute"

"It easily stands-up against any other of this genre"

"Far excels in telling this important story"

"A long list of well respected, articulate, powerful, and well-grounded individuals"

"An excellent new documentary about life on Mars"

"I can summarize my feedback -- It's fucking cool and I love it"
